result.execSummary:
The defendant Laython W Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: restitution to be determined w/in 30 days.
No contact with Jeremy Filocha (DOB 01/19/1996).  No Contact with Bailey Hart (DOB 10/10/1997) without prior written approval from probation/ parole agent

submit DNA sample if not previously obtained.  Follow through with any treatment/programming as recommended by your agent.  Completion of Domestic Violence programming.  Follow any rules of community supervision.   Absolute sobriety at all times. Not to possess any alcohol.  Not to use, possess, or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia.  Report all prescriptions to your agent within 72 hours of prescription.  Use only 1 prescribing physician and pharmacy for your medications.

timeConds.notes: with huber.  Begin date to be determined by probation agent.  May be served in Sauk County if approved by sheriff department.
